author: Charles Wallace
title: Dietary Advice Based on the Bacteria in Your Gut
text:
For almost a decade, researchers have been sequencing the bacteria that live in the human gut. Now, some startups are claiming they can use that technology to help people diet more effectively—and in at least one case, scientists say the approach is showing some promise.
The companies are aiming to address a problem identified in recent years: Standard nutritional advice doesn’t work for everyone. Research shows that people fed identical foods can have vastly different blood-glucose responses, which may explain why one person...
